title: What is the difference between a player who has received >500-1,000 chat restricts and
body:
a player who has been temp-banned?

I don't see how these players are getting more restricts instead of getting banned, and why they're getting a free pass (IF they behave the rest of the season) to earn their season rewards when the only way to receive that many chat bans is to CONSISTENTLY be toxic while placed under restriction over a period that is much longer than any temp-ban.

I am just wondering the logic behind these players being any more deserving of their season rewards vs. players who have been banned. Are those that are banned simply that much more toxic than someone with an insanely large amount of chat restricted games? 
Shouldn't any reformed player (riot probably has data that can show who has reformed vs. who hasn't. right?) be eligible for rewards? 

What do you guys think? Is my confusion over this justified? I just feel as if there is a weird inconsistency going on here that isn't being properly addressed.
